values:
No writing for me today 

however, I was thinking about Kathy Acker today and how she believes you should only write once you don't hear all that whispering, once there is no song so you can get down into the emotion of it

I like how this is making me think about writing more, making me go back and re-read essays (like Writers on Writing) and think about what some of my favorites have said... of course, I wanna try my hand at mimicing Saramago sentences, too. 

I feel the geek rising in me full force. 

Being a creative geek, a lit/writing geek = beautiful stuff
even if it isn't as appreciated in the world
even if you speak your own language 
deeply contexted
deeply nuanced
deeply geeky

ok

to bed with this one
tomorrow looks free for writing, writing, writing

To begin: Songbird Eva Cassidy But when the album started to play, there was a hiss of ugliness. After busying myself with trying to make sure there was nothing I could do with it... I took it out. A false beginning. To begin: Still the Same Me. Sweet Honey in the Rock that proved too bright moved to Black Angels Kronos Quartet and Cesaria Evora's self-titled will take me home.

So, this year, I am doing things much differently. For example, I have absolutely no idea what I am going to write, just that I am going to write. Last year, my efforts were dashed by an over-developed idea -- an idea I have had since senior year of college that started to morph as soon as I started writing it. Displeased with the morphing, although pleased with the direction and work... I stopped. Also, I was in Seattle and the only person I knew irl doing the thing. Ugh. 

This year is different. This year, I live in Seattle. This year, I have no idea what I am going to write which means I can write anything I want without worrying about it morphing. Maybe I can unteach some of my creative rigidness in order to enjoy creative freedom -- completely. I can't fucking wait!

What I am wondering... is there a breakdown? Like a number of words needed to be complete every week in order to make the goal? Quite possibly, this is the longest thing I have written and definately in the smallest amount of space. (I have to check on that -- I could be wrong...) There can be no over-editing, no killing of passages, no over-stressing... I feel the freedom already. 

I am so excited, yet a little scared, too... exactly where I wanna be -- anticipating, yet not over-confident. 

I wonder what music my gut will request.
